KEY OBJECTIVES: EARTH SCIENTISTS ARE STRUGGLING TO EXTRACT NEW INSIGHTS FROM A SEA OF LARGE DATA SETS ORIGINATING FROM MULTIPLE INSTRUMENTS. THE GOAL OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO PROVIDE ENHANCED ASSISTANCE TO ENABLE THE MOST BENEFICIAL DIVISION BETWEEN HUMAN AND MACHINE EFFORTS. WE PROPOSE THE CREATION OF ENHANCED ENVIRONMENTS FOR COMPUTER-AIDED DISCOVERY THAT SUPPORT HUMANS IN THE SEARCH PROCESS OF MAKING NEW DISCOVERIES RELATED TO EARTH SURFACE DEFORMATION PHENOMENA.

BPA CALL ORDER TITLE: GREENHOUSE GAS (GHG) INVENTORY SUPPORT FOR WASTEWATER AND COAL MINING THE PURPOSE OF THIS ORDER IS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE IN IMPROVING THE ABILITY OF THE UNITED STATES TO PRODUCE ACCURATE AND TRANSPARENT NATIONAL INVENTORIES OF GREENHOUSE GAS (GHG) EMISSIONS FROM WASTEWATER AND COAL MINING, SPECIFICALLY DOMESTIC AND INDUSTRIAL WASTEWATER TREATMENT PROCESSES AND ACTIVE AND ABANDONED COAL MINES IN THE UNITED STATES. THE FOCUS OF THIS WORK WILL BE ON (1) USING THE BEST AVAILABLE METHODS FOR CALCULATING U.S. GHG EMISSIONS FROM WASTEWATER TREATMENT AND COAL MINING, (2) IMPROVING THESE METHODS AND DATA INPUTS WHERE POSSIBLE BASED ON A VARIETY OF SOURCES INCLUDING ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY'S (EPA'S) GREENHOUSE GAS REPORTING PROGRAM, AND (3) REPORTING ON THESE EMISSIONS ESTIMATES IN A MANNER THAT FACILITATES TRANSPARENCY, CONSISTENCY, ACCURACY, COMPARABILITY AND COMPLETENESS. IN ADDITION, IT IS TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE DEVELOPING COUNTRIES IN THEIR CAPACITY TO PERFORM SIMILAR WORK TOWARD ESTIMATING AND TRACKING GHG EMISSIONS FROM WASTEWATER AND COAL MINING FOR PURPOSES OF NATIONAL INVENTORIES. doc.ContractDescription: IGF::CL,CT::IGF PROFESSIONAL ACQUISITION SUPPORT SERVICES (PASS) II

THE UNPRECEDENTED AVAILABILITY OF SEA SURFACE SALINITY (SSS) DATA AVAILABLE FROM SATELLITE MEASUREMENTS FROM AQUARIUS AND SMOS HAS THE POTENTIAL TO REVOLUTIONIZE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF VARIABILITY ACROSS A NUMBER OF SCALES OF THE EARTH S WATER CYCLE. HOWEVER, THE USEFULNESS OF THESE DATA IS PREDICATED ON BOTH A SOUND UNDERSTANDING OF THE UNCERTAINTY OF THE DATA, AND A SOUND UNDERSTANDING OF HOW THE SSS AS SEEN AT 1 CM BY A SATELLITE-BORNE RADIOMETER IS RELATED TO THE OCEAN MIXED LAYER SALINITY. THE CRITICALITY OF THIS UNDERSTANDING HAS BEEN UNDERSCORED BY THE FORMATION OF A WORKING GROUP AIMED AT COLLABORATIONS BETWEEN RESEARCHERS TO UNDERSTAND THE NEAR-SURFACE SALINITY VARIABILITY. THIS PROBLEM IS SIMILAR IN MANY RESPECTS TO THE NEED OF THE SATELLITE SEA SURFACE TEMPERATURE (SST) COMMUNITY TO UNDERSTAND THE UPPER OCEAN TEMPERATURE STRUCTURE. TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE SSS COMMUNITY, A CONCERTED DATA ANALYSIS APPROACH COMBINED WITH OCEAN MODELING FOCUSED ON UNDERSTANDING VARIABILITY IN THE UPPER FEW METERS OF THE OCEAN SURFACE WILL PROVIDE INSIGHTS. OUR GOAL IS TO USE THE UNPRECEDENTED COVERAGE OF SSS DATA OFFERED BY AQUARIUS IN TANDEM WITH NEAR-SURFACE SALINITY MEASUREMENTS AVAILABLE FROM SPURS, IN SITU BUOYS AND THE ARGO FLOAT PROGRAM AND MODELING ANALYSES TO BETTER CHARACTERIZE AND PARAMETERIZE THE SURFACE SALINITY STRATIFICATION WITH RESPECT TO ATMOSPHERIC VARIABILITY. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS, WE WILL DO THE FOLLOWING: (1) CHARACTERIZE THE UPPER OCEAN SALINITY VARIABILITY AND ITS RELATIONSHIP TO ATMOSPHERIC FORCING BY ANALYSIS OF DATA AVAILABLE FROM THE SALINITY PROCESSES IN THE UPPER OCEAN REGIONAL STUDY (SPURS) AND IN SITU BUOYS WITH BOTH SEA SURFACE AND NEAR-SURFACE TEMPERATURE AND SALINITY MEASUREMENTS. ONE-DIMENSIONAL (AND IN THE CASE OF SPURS THREE-DIMENSIONAL) OCEAN MODELS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE FURTHER UNDERSTANDING OF THE SENSITIVITIES OF THE UPPER OCEAN SALINITY STRATIFICATION TO THE SURFACE FRESHWATER, HEAT, AND MOMENTUM FLUXES. (2) CREATE A CO-LOCATED SET OF SATELLITE SSS POINTS WITH ARGO AND OTHER IN SITU DATA SETS. AS PART OF THIS ANALYSIS WE WILL ENHANCE THE WHOI ARGO FLOAT SYSTEM BY ANALYZING THE RAW 1 HZ (10 CM SAMPLING) DATA AVAILABLE FROM SOME CURRENT AND FUTURE FLOATS, AS WELL AS PROGRAMMING A SMALL GROUP OF FLOATS UNDER CERTAIN CONDITIONS TO PRODUCE A HIGH TEMPORAL RESOLUTION (3 HOURLY) SET OF PROFILES TO INVESTIGATE THE BIAS EFFECTS OF THE DIURNAL CYCLE ON THE SATELLITE MEASUREMENTS. WE WILL USE THESE MATCHED OBSERVATIONS TO EXPLORE THE REPRESENTATIVENESS OF AQUARIUS AND SMOS OBSERVATIONS WITH THAT OF THE SALINITIES AT DEPTH. USING SATELLITE-DERIVED WEATHER REGIMES WE WILL EXPLORE HOW SURFACE AND DEEPER SALINITIES ARE RELATED UNDER SPECIFIC WEATHER/SURFACE FORCING REGIMES, AND TO WHAT EXTENT THIS IS COMPARABLE TO THE IN SITU DATA/MODELING ANALYSIS.(3) PARAMETERIZE THE UPPER OCEAN SALINITY STRATIFICATION BASED ON THE OBSERVATIONAL/MODEL RESULTS, AND USE THIS PARAMETERIZATION TO PROVIDE INFORMATION ON SKIN SALINITY VARIABILITY AFFECTING THE AQUARIUS-ARGO MATCHUPS. WE ANTICIPATE THAT THE OUTCOMES OF OUR RESEARCH INCLUDE AN IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF THE STRATIFICATION OF THE UPPER OCEAN SALINITY STRUCTURE AND ITS RELATIONSHIP TO SURFACE FLUXES OF HEAT, FRESHWATER, AND MOMENTUM; A PARAMETERIZATION THAT ESTIMATES SALINITY DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE SURFACE AND DEPTH AS A FUNCTION OF SURFACE FRESHWATER FORCING AND MIXING; AND AN IMPROVED UNDERSTANDING OF AQUARIUS ERROR CHARACTERISTICS.

doc.ContractDescription: MULTIPLE AWARD TASK ORDER CONTRACT FOR BHS FACILITIES, MA.
IGF::OT::IGF COMPREHENSIVE MEDICAL CONTRACT - OUTSIDE HOSPITAL SERVICES FOR FMC DEVENS INMATE POPULATION.

THE LOCAL INTERSTELLAR MEDIUM (LISM) IS DOMINATED BY THE LARGE, VERY LOW DENSITY CAVITY THAT SURROUNDS OUR LOCATION KNOWN AS THE LOCAL BUBBLE. INSIDE THE BUBBLE ARE SEVERAL LOW DENSITY CLOUDS INCLUDING THE ONE THAT SURROUNDS THE SOLAR SYSTEM KNOWN AS THE LOCAL INTERSTELLAR CLOUD (LIC). DIRECT EVIDENCE FROM THE OBSERVED DIFFUSE SOFT X-RAY BACKGROUND AND INDIRECT EVIDENCE FROM THE DYNAMICS OF THE THE NEARBY CLOUDS INDICATES THAT THE LOCAL BUBBLE IS FILLED WITH HOT GAS. WE PROPOSE TO INVESTIGATE THE ORIGINS AND EVOLUTION OF THE LOCAL BUBBLE AS CREATED BY ONE OR MORE SUPERNOVA EXPLOSIONS. IN ADDITION WE WILL INVESTIGATE HOW THE LIC HAS BEEN ABLE TO SURVIVE THE SHOCK THAT CREATED THE HOT GAS IN THE LOCAL BUBBLE AND ITS EVOLUTION TO ITS CURRENT STATE AS A WARM, PARTIALLY IONIZED CLOUD. WE WILL USE STATE-OF-THE-ART NUMERICAL MAGNETO-HYDRODYNAMICAL CODES COUPLED WITH THE APEC PLASMA EMISSION CODE AND DUST DESTRUCTION CALCULATIONS TO CALCULATE THE EVOLUTION OF THE BUBBLE AND THE LIC. OUR STUDIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE LARGE ARRAY OF DATA AVAILABLE ON BOTH THE LOCAL BUBBLE AND THE LIC, INCLUDING IN SITU DATA OBTAINED BY SPACECRAFT THAT HAVE DETECTED INTERSTELLAR MATTER FLOWING INTO THE HELIOSPHERE. THIS WORK WILL BE THE FIRST MODELING OF THE LISM TO INCLUDE INFORMATION FROM RECENT OBSERVATIONS AND MODELS THAT TIGHTLY CONSTRAIN THE NATURE OF THE LOCAL BUBBLE AND THE LIC AND WILL HAVE IMPLICATIONS FOR SUPERNOVA REMNANT EVOLUTION AND SHOCK-CLOUD INTERACTION WELL BEYOND THE LISM.
doc.MajorAgency: THE EVOLUTION OF THE MULTI-PHASE LOCAL INTERSTELLA
doc.MajorFundingAgency: THE EVOLUTION OF THE MULTI-PHASE LOCAL INTERSTELLA

doc.ContractDescription: ONE OF THE GOALS OF THE SUOMI VIIRS INSTRUMENT IS TO PROVIDE A CONTINUATION OF THE EOS RECORD OF CLIMATE-QUALITY OBSERVATIONS IN THE POST-EOS SENSOR ERA. HOWEVER, NOT ALL OF THE SCIENCE DATA PRODUCTS BEING PRODUCED BY THE EOS INSTRUMENTS WERE INCLUDED IN THE ORIGINAL SUOMI PROGRAM. NASA HAS DECIDED TO INCLUDE SEVERAL SUCH OMITTED EOS DATA PRODUCTS, INCLUDING LAI AND FPAR, AS PART OF THE SUITE OF DATA PRODUCTS TO BE GENERATED FROM THE VIIRS INSTRUMENTAL DATA. IN RESPONSE TO THE FIRST CALL IN 2010, THE PI S PROPOSAL TO PROVIDE THE ALGORITHM, QUALITY CONTROL AND VALIDATE THE LAI/FPAR PRODUCTS WAS SELECTED FOR INVESTIGATION. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS SUCCESSOR PROPOSAL IS TO PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN THE ALGORITHM FOR OPERATIONAL PRODUCTION OF GLOBAL LAI/FPAR SCIENCE DATA RECORDS BY THE NASA SUOMI NPP LAND SIPS FROM SUOMI VIIRS DATA AND TO EVALUATE THESE PRODUCTS TO ASSURE CONTINUITY WITH THE EOS MODIS PRODUCT TIME SERIES. THIS OBJECTIVE IS REALIZED THROUGH THREE SETS OF RESEARCH ACTIVITIES (A) VIIRS LAI/FPAR ALGORITHM REFINEMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION, (B) EVALUATION OF VIIRS LAI/FPAR ESDRS FOR ACCURACY, PRECISION, UNCERTAINTY, SPATIAL COVERAGE AND CONTINUITY, AND (C) VIIRS PROJECT ACTIVITIES. THE TANGIBLE END PRODUCT OF THIS PROPOSAL WILL BE A CONTINUOUS, WELL-CHARACTERIZED, LONG TIME SERIES OF GLOBAL LAI AND FPAR PRODUCTS, SPANNING THE EOS AND NPP ERA, SUITABLE FOR RESEARCH IN EARTH SYSTEM SCIENCE, GLOBAL CHANGE AND APPLICATION STUDIES.

doc.MajorFundingAgency: GLOBAL LAI-FPAR EARTH SYSTEM DATA RECORDS FROM SUO

doc.ContractDescription: IGF::OT::IGF OTHER FUNCTIONS THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO ADD ADDITIONAL $162,000.00. INCREMENTAL FUNDING AMOUNT CHANGED: FROM $1,693,000.00 TO $1,855,704.00. THIS IS A T&M TASK ORDER AND THE CONTRACTOR SHALL NOT INCUR ANY COSTS IN EXCESS OF THE FUNDED CEILING OF THE ORDER. IN THE EVENT THE FUNDED CEILING IS REACHED, WORK SHALL STOP AND CONTRACTING OFFICER SHALL BE NOTIFIED. TRAVEL SHALL BE BILLED AND REIMBURSED IN ACCORDANCE WITH FEDERAL TRAVEL REGULATION. TRAVEL SHALL NOT EXCEED THE CEILING AMOUNTS SET FORTH ON CLAUSES AND VENDOR'S QUOTE. ALL OTHER TERMS AND CONDITIONS REMAIN UNCHANGED.
